Hi Erik - I'm not quite sure what you are trying to say. Unit tests in the classic sense are mutually exclusive from functional tests. There may be some overlap in coverage, but there is no union of test cases. 

Is what you are trying to say is that you want to use Junit as a framework and harness for black box functional testing of Java API's? 


Cheers,
Bill 
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: erikstunkat 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, April 17, 2002 4:26 AM
  Subject: [junit] junit tests and functional/ integration tests


  Hi,
  I know that unit tests should run on their own and every test should 
  be executable of its own - but..
  we want to use unit tests for a QA related functional framework and 
  we yet defined some tasks with ant to run tests in a specific order. 
  My question: is there any extension for junit to define properties 
  for tests in a more straightforward way then java properties files 
  (xml?) and to combine several unit tests with global attributes and 
  properties?

  thanks in advance!

  erik stunkat
